page.title: 04WOBURN PARK :1
page.content:
The park surrounding Woburn Abbey is extremely impressive. It covers some 3000 acres and was originally laid down by Repton, being a mix of deciduous and coniferous woodland and extensive grassland. It has held a number of herds of deer since earlier this century, some now extremely rare breeds and virtually saved from extinction by breeding at Woburn.
The park has held a great variety of activities, in fact these have been held since long before the more commercial attitude of recent years. There have been car hill climbs, game fairs, specialist car meetings, caravan rallies and a host of other activities.
